comment.body: You can get several seeders by adding to the list on http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LtvsjbtQ2tY7SCtCZzC4KhErqEK3bXD4n/

If you make a user's data.json unwritable, you won't see any more updates from them.  That might cause some problems eventually, but @nofish hasn't added a better method that ZeroNet would be aware of.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/zatogra.bit/
@Fav: @kaffie has been making ZeroNet links look more natural with some browser modifications: http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.kaffie.bit
@Method-X: in particular, Beelzebub could be anyone using bit.no.com.
@Spukkin Faceship: at least we know which account the proxy uses. :P

We are unanimous
We have quorum
We do not deceive
We do not dissent
Accept us

ZeroTorrent is really disorganized.  It's probably best to hope the search finds what you want.  The site owner is looking for help:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:7_19sggoAZ4hcorrrfWoFWP9rwfpVsL29cnZ/KICKASS+TORRENTS
@Unanimous: The KAT site is really a clone of ZeroTorrent.  Its owner hasn't been seen for several days, but the ZeroTalk discussion below has a link to the gitlab project.

[ZeroISR](http://127.0.0.1:43110/12oGb8xBjLYz23CGJxRQyzZ6mGybZokEKt/) has files up to 70MB which transfer successfully, but over 100MB might be unreliable.  http://127.0.0.1:43110/16iXY7BX8UF1j2NJVQHADyuGorFJKFvnzG/ has 150MB in three files and rarely transfers the two close to 1kB.
@nofish: this must be another overwritten post, even with the timestamp.

It was added to [ZeroISR](http://127.0.0.1:43110/12oGb8xBjLYz23CGJxRQyzZ6mGybZokEKt/) but a glitch removed it.  With recent versions of Bittorrent deteriorating, it's a good alternative.  The most recent version might have more efficient IO.  There are very many things shared through its channels feature.  RSS works much better than in Bittorrent.  The main sources of frustration for me are some inconsistent UI behavior and the poorly organized transfer list.
hello world :D
[Find a customer](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1EzPDDHciaG9AH4ErxsmAKsF4hsrJPktiM/)
Is your sidebar working?
http://www.smbc-comics.com/comic/teach-a-man-to-fish

There is a [KickAssTorrents](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LBr1dHoXvJAMjDgW8Wcg5kbCoKyJnzo6p/) project.  Currently it is a clone of [ZeroTorrent](http://127.0.0.1:43110/ZeroTorrent.bit/).  kickasstorrents@zeroid.bit has a [gitlab page](https://gitlab.com/kickasstorrents/KAT).

You reached the posting limit of 2MB. :(
@sirenyc reached that some time ago.  Maybe you could contact [@someone](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit/?to=someone).  So far, nobody has been able to get the quota increased.  To keep posting, you could use [KAT](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LBr1dHoXvJAMjDgW8Wcg5kbCoKyJnzo6p/) or [一个网站](http://127.0.0.1:43110/wangzhan.bit/).
@Yggdrasil: you could chat in http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeromedia.bit/
fail :(

[IFTTT](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IFTTT) seems like it could be integrated into ZeroNet relatively easily.  Harder if you want it to react to things outside ZeroNet.  Maybe add it to the [suggestion list](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1_1JgHfDK4eojCkVZHKey9hiMAcAc9mxMUK2/Post+Your+Ideas+For+Apps)?
@Durand: there is a Javascript library called [sandblaster](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CiDoBP8RiWziqiBGEd8tQMy66A6fmnw2V/big/js/sandblaster.min.js) that can detect and possibly break out of iframes.
